
{{alias}}( k, λ )
    Returns a pseudorandom number drawn from an Erlang distribution.

    If `k` is not a positive integer or `λ <= 0`, the function returns `NaN`.

    If `k` or `λ` is `NaN`, the function returns `NaN`.

    Parameters
    ----------
    k: integer
        Shape parameter.

    λ: number
        Rate parameter.

    Returns
    -------
    r: number
        Pseudorandom number.

    Examples
    --------
    > var r = {{alias}}( 2, 5.0 );


{{alias}}.factory( [k, λ, ][options] )
    Returns a pseudorandom number generator (PRNG) for generating pseudorandom
    numbers drawn from an Erlang distribution.

    If provided `k` and `λ`, the returned PRNG returns random variates drawn
    from the specified distribution.

    If not provided `k` and `λ`, the returned PRNG requires that both `k` and
    `λ` be provided at each invocation.

    Parameters
    ----------
    k: integer (optional)
        Shape parameter.

    λ: number (optional)
        Rate parameter.

    options: Object (optional)
        Options.

    options.seed: any (optional)
        Pseudorandom number generator seed.

    Returns
    -------
    rand: Function
        Pseudorandom number generator (PRNG).

    Examples
    --------
    // Basic usage:
    > var rand = {{alias}}.factory();
    > var r = rand( 2, 1.0 );
    > r = rand( 4, 3.14 );

    // Provide `k` and `λ`:
    > rand = {{alias}}.factory( 2, 1.5 );
    > r = rand();
    > r = rand();


{{alias}}.NAME
    Generator name.

    Examples
    --------
    > var str = {{alias}}.NAME
    'erlang'


{{alias}}.PRNG
    Underlying pseudorandom number generator.

    Examples
    --------
    > var prng = {{alias}}.PRNG;


{{alias}}.seed
    Pseudorandom number generator seed.

    Examples
    --------
    > var seed = {{alias}}.seed;


{{alias}}.STATE
    Generator state.

    Examples
    --------
    > var r = {{alias}}( 2, 5.0 )
    <number>
    > r = {{alias}}( 2, 5.0 )
    <number>
    > r = {{alias}}( 2, 5.0 )
    <number>

    // Get a copy of the current state:
    > var state = {{alias}}.STATE
    <Uint32Array>

    > r = {{alias}}( 2, 5.0 )
    <number>
    > r = {{alias}}( 2, 5.0 )
    <number>

    // Set the state:
    > {{alias}}.STATE = state;

    // Replay the last two pseudorandom numbers:
    > r = {{alias}}( 2, 5.0 )
    <number>
    > r = {{alias}}( 2, 5.0 )
    <number>


{{alias}}.STATE_LENGTH
    Length of generator state.

    Examples
    --------
    > var len = {{alias}}.STATE_LENGTH;


{{alias}}.STATE_SIZE
    Size (in bytes) of generator state.

    Examples
    --------
    > var sz = {{alias}}.STATE_SIZE;

    See Also
    --------
